summary: Email correspondence between attorney Gloria Allred and a federal prosecutor regarding scheduling a meeting for one of Allred's clients, an Epstein victim, to meet with prosecutors in New York on August 19, 2019. The emails discuss travel arrangements and the client's initial decision not to proceed, which was later reversed.

persons.name: Gloria Allred
persons.context: Attorney communicating with federal prosecutors to arrange a meeting for her client, an Epstein victim, to provide information.

persons.name: Diane Aldrich
persons.context: Assistant who would handle travel arrangements for the client with the federal agent.

connections.description: Allred instructs the federal agent to contact her assistant Diane to arrange client travel details.
Allred represents a client who is an Epstein victim and is arranging for her to meet with federal prosecutors.

events.title: Scheduled meeting with Epstein victim
events.description: A meeting was scheduled for an Epstein victim represented by Gloria Allred to meet with federal prosecutors in New York.

events.title: Client initially declines to meet
events.description: The client initially decided she did not wish to meet with prosecutors, but later changed her mind.

keyFacts: Gloria Allred, a prominent attorney, was representing at least one victim of Jeffrey Epstein in August 2019.
A meeting was scheduled for August 19, 2019, in New York between federal prosecutors and an Epstein victim represented by Allred.
The victim initially declined to meet with prosecutors but later agreed, demonstrating the difficulty victims faced in coming forward.
Travel arrangements for the victim were to be coordinated between a federal agent and Allred's assistant, Diane Aldrich.
The correspondence shows ongoing cooperation between victim attorneys and federal prosecutors in the Southern District of New York investigation.
